I understand you're concerned about taxes in Canada on a low income. 

It's great that you're thinking about this!  

**Here's the good news:**

* **You likely won't owe a lot of taxes.** Canada has a progressive tax system, meaning people with lower incomes pay a smaller percentage of their income in taxes.
* **There are tax credits and benefits available to help.** These can significantly reduce your tax burden or even result in a refund.

**To figure out if you need to pay taxes, you'll need to:**

1. **Calculate your income:** This includes all your earnings from work, investments, and other sources.
2. **Know your personal situation:** Things like your age, marital status, dependents, and province of residence affect your tax obligations.
3. **Consider basic personal amount:**  This is a tax-free amount everyone can claim, reducing your taxable income.

**Here are some resources that can help:**

* **Canada Revenue Agency (CRA) website:** [https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency.html](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency.html)
    * Their website has detailed information about tax credits, deductions, and filing requirements.
* **CRA's "Do I need to file a tax return?" tool:** [https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/tax/individuals/topics/about-your-tax-return/do-i-need-file-tax-return.html](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/tax/individuals/topics/about-your-tax-return/do-i-need-file-tax-return.html)
* **Community Volunteer Income Tax Program (CVITP):**  Offers free tax preparation services to low-income individuals. Find a location near you: [https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/tax/individuals/community-volunteer-income-tax-program.html](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/tax/individuals/community-volunteer-income-tax-program.html)

**Remember:**

* Even if you don't owe taxes, it's important to file your return to claim any benefits you may be eligible for.
* Don't be afraid to ask for help. The CRA and community organizations are there to support you.


I hope this information is helpful!
